attributes.action: Insist that OFCOM and the ASA stop Broadband Providers advertising 'unlimited' services that are in fact limited in the small print or by un-defined fair use policies.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Many ISP's (Internet Service providers) are advertising Broadband with 'Unlimited' downloads.  The majority of these services are not unlimited as in the providers fair usage policies they either cap the use at a defioned amount, or use an undefined criteria that only they know.

government_responses.details:
You recently signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "Insist that OFCOM and the ASA stop Broadband Providers advertising 'unlimited' services that are in fact limited in the small print or by un-defined fair use policies."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.pm.gov.uk/output/Page12235.asp

Prime Minister's Office
